query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

result.title: Material for general training in Living Labs and for on-line training modules
result.description: This document will provide the contents related to the horizontal (general) training to be carried out in the first part of the Living Labs, in order to guarantee coherence and homogeneity to all the HAPPEN pilots. . The materials will regard all the training sessions carried out, which will be segmented for the different target groups involved (e.g.: behavioral enhancement for end users, technical solutions for professionals, process and financial solutions for real estate owners and developers), so to address the specific needs of each groups.

result.title: Material for MedZEB vertical training in Living Labs
result.description: This document will provide the contents related to the vertical (specialized) training to be carried out in the second part of the Living Labs, in order to guarantee coherence and homogeneity to all the HAPPEN pilots. Such vertical training will be aimed to incubate the creation of the local supply chains (LCSs) on the basis of the MedZEB protocol, in view of the design, realization and monitoring of the retrofitting works within the Pilots.

result.title: Catalogue of reference buildings classes in Mediterranean countries
result.description: This long document will contain the second part of the research results obtained in Task 3.1 “Identification of representative climates and reference buildings in Med countries”, with regard to the analysis carried out on the residential existing building stock in the Mediterranean countries, which will lead to the identification of 6 different reference buildings, representative of large buildings groups. Each selected building will be described with respect both to its technical characters and to its representativeness level; an introduction will explain the methodology followed for the selection, while the Appendix will illustrate in details the reasons for the choice of the reference buildings.

result.title: MedZEB certification scheme outline (Second Batch)
result.description: This document further develops the connections between the MedZEB VCS and the MedZEB Protocol on the basis of the general framework of the existing certification schemes In particular the VCS is seen in relation to the Protocol process scheme starting from the choice of the renovation target operational intervention alternative ie one step stepbystep and level of analysis up to the issue of the certificate Moreover the assessment of energy and comfort targets is described through specific KPIs also taking the different levels of analysis into account Achievement of the targets is certified through the tailored VCS scoring system which is illustrated through relevant examples

result.title: MedZEB protocol
result.description: Short document containing the structure of the MedZEB Protocol (MZP), intended as a shared operative framework for setting up and enabling local supply and value chains, in order to guarantee the overall quality of the process and design performances (energetic, financial, environmental and well-being) according to the MedZEB approach.

result.title: MedZEB protocol - Second Batch
result.description: This deliverable further develops the MedZEB Protocol definition and relevant features by focusing on the retrofitting intervention target the operational intervention alternative ie one stepstepbystep the level of analysis and the relevant certification The phases of the Protocol process scheme and the actors involved are described in detail In this respect the MedZEB Protocol reflects and supports the implementation of the HAPPEN Programme thus putting the MedZEB Approach into practice The framework of guarantees offered by the Protocol to the relevant stakeholders of the building retrofitting value chain is described in detail

result.title: Report on representative climates and zoning
result.description: This long document will contain the first part of the research results obtained in Task 3.1 “Identification of representative climates and reference buildings in Med countries”, with regard to 12-15 representative climates in Med countries. Each climate will be described according to all the parameters assumed by the project as relevant for the overall evaluation of consumption and wellbeing conditions.

result.title: Pilot Operative Plans
result.description: Long document containing the detailed Pilot Plans produced by each Pilot Leader where all the pilot actions are duly described including a complete pilot agenda human resources to be committed highlighting the actions already activated before the project start and providing details on how HAPPEN will complement and interact with ongoing or already planned actions Such plans will be developed on the basis of a common template provided by the Work Package Leader which will include the key performance indicators selected for the comparative stepbystep monitoring of the pilots and the rules for producing the periodic reports for monitoring and quality control

result.title: Report on optimal packages of solutions
result.description: This short document will contain the results of the optimization work carried out in Task 3.3 “Calculations on reference buildings and identification of optimal integrated packages of solutions”, where the needed investment and savings related to each renovation measure (see D3.3) will be calculated on the reference buildings (see D3.2) and on different climate zones (see D3.1), in order to define at least 5 optimal packages of solutions, which will include an evaluation of an optimal step-by-step renovation approach. The optimization will be done in terms of the minimum investment and minimum amortization period that will lead to optimal packages for step-by step refurbishment in order to develop a MedZEB step-by-step technical approach, as an alternative to traditional refurbishment approach in order to foster the market uptake.

result.title: Abacus of “renovation measures” at building and district scale
result.description: This long document will contain the results of the analysis carried out in Task 3.2 “Identification of integrated renovation measures”, where at least 150 integrated alternative/complementary Renovation Measures will be fully described, synthesized into a 12x12 “Renovation Measures” Abacus/Matrix. These “integrated Renovation Measures” will be assembled with an holistic approach, considering country-specific peculiarities, combined actions on the building envelope, technological systems and facilities, Renewable Energy Sources integration, Building Management Systems, Behavioral measures and also measures that can be applied at urban or district scale and are not specifically designed for buildings (shading, heat islands, de-sealing, breezes, Renewable Energy Sources, etc.) in order to maximize the impact of the overall intervention.

result.title: MedZeb monitoring protocol
result.description: This protocol will describe the MedZEB monitoring system which will be applied during the pilot project and which will be the basis for the monitoring of the pilots results after the project finalization In particular the following elements will be considered High Quality Dataset for energy and environmental parameters Definition of the Energy Performance of the pilot buildings Post Occupancy Evaluation Climate change impact
